TopicTitle: When i create a planet (using Kopernicus mod) kerbals can't stand on the planet. how do i fix this?

Articles.Content:
When a kerbal tries to stand on my planet he just freezes and falls (When the kerbal fell he can't move), to get him back to the command pod i have to use the jetpack.

Can anyone tell me how to fix this?

Edited November 2, 2015 by alex_1313
I know that this doesn't help, but this happened to me too. That's why I'm giving it a *bump*

When a kerbal tries to stand on my planet he just freezes and falls (When the kerbal fell he can't move), to get him back to the command pod i have to use the jetpack.

Can anyone tell me how to fix this?

Are you using the template from Kopernicus Examples? Those are, sorry, outdated.

RA3236 said:
Are you using the template from Kopernicus Examples? Those are, sorry, outdated.

I didn't use the template for my first planet (and kerbals just fell), but when i edited Jool to be solid kerbals couldn't stand on it, thay just fall and clip through the surface texture.
